abstract: Big pharmaceutical companies sometimes calculated to the penny the profits that doctors could make from their cancer drugs and shared those estimates with doctors.
snippet: Big pharmaceutical companies sometimes calculated to the penny the profits that doctors could make from their cancer drugs and shared those estimates with doctors.
lead_paragraph: Medicare’s decision to reform the way it paid for cancer drugs came after a decade in which oncologists collectively made billions of dollars on the drugs they prescribed. Many doctors say those profits did not affect their prescribing patterns.

headline.main: Cancer Drug Representatives Spelled Out the Way to Profit
headline.print_headline: Cancer Drug Representatives Spelled Out the Way to Profit
